Unreliable electricity grids, coupled with post-harvest spoilage, drive poverty and environmental degradation. Smallholders lack access to affordable solar infrastructure or data to optimize use
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

AgriSolar Exchange would use ServiceNow’s Asset, Field Service, and Sustainability Management modules:

  • Field Service Management for maintaining solar hubs and assigning technicians.
  • Asset Management to track solar equipment usage and uptime.
  • Sustainability Management to measure CO₂ reductions and generate sustainability reports.
  • IntegrationHub to link IoT sensors for solar performance data.
  • Flow Designer to automate repair requests and usage billing.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • IoT sensors for tracking solar usage and energy output.
  • APIs for carbon accounting and verification tools.
  • Mobile money integration for pay-as-you-use billing.
  • GPS mapping services for locating solar hubs.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Challenges include funding initial solar installations, ensuring maintenance capacity in rural areas, managing IoT data integrity, and building trust with farmers unfamiliar with digital tools.
